name: adventure
trans: n. 冒险；冒险精神；投机活动 vt. 冒险；大胆说出 vi. 冒险

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.english: an adventure story
sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

detailed_translations.english: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

name: clue
trans: n. 线索；（故事等的）情节 vt. 为…提供线索；为…提供情况

sentences.english: Police have found a vital clue .
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了至关重要的线索。

sentences.english: Archaeological evidence will provide clues about what the building was used for.
sentences.chinese: 考古证据将为这幢建筑的用途提供线索。

sentences.english: a desperate search for clues
sentences.chinese: 拼命寻找线索

detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

name: direction
trans: n. 方向；指导；趋势；用法说明

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字 n. (Legend)人名；(西)莱亨德；(英)莱金德

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: mystery
trans: n. 秘密，谜；神秘，神秘的事物；推理小说，推理剧；常作 mysteries 秘技，秘诀

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: flattered
trans: adj. 高兴的， 感到荣幸的；过分夸赞 v. 奉承（flatter的过去分词）；阿谀奉承

name: labor
trans: n. 劳动；工作；劳工；分娩 vi. 劳动；努力；苦干 vt. 详细分析；使厌烦 n. (Labor)人名；(德、塞、法)拉博尔；(英)拉博

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: obey
trans: vt. 服从，听从；按照……行动 vi. 服从，顺从；听话 n. (Obey)人名；(英、法)奥贝

sentences.english: The little boy made no effort to obey.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩不肯服从。

sentences.english: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
sentences.chinese: “坐下！”他说道，那只狗马上就服从了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

name: peddler
trans: n. 小贩；传播者

detailed_translations.english: A drug peddler is a person who sells illegal drugs

name: sorcery
trans: n. 魔术，巫术

sentences.english: But it may not take a magician or sorcery to furnish a room with just a box.
sentences.chinese: 但是仅仅依靠一个魔术师或者一种巫术去用一个箱子来装饰房间大概是不可能的吧。

sentences.english: With the appearance of primitive belief came the dances of totem, sorcery, and sacrificial ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 随着原始信仰的出现而形成了图腾舞蹈、巫术舞蹈、祭祀舞蹈。

sentences.english: Since a name was considered an integral part of a person, it could be an effective target for sorcery.
sentences.chinese: 因为名字被认为是一个人的重要组成部分，就有可能成为巫术的有效攻击靶子。

detailed_translations.english: magic that uses the power of evil forces

name: summon
trans: vt. 召唤；召集；鼓起；振作

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

name: atom
trans: n. 原子

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

name: molecule
trans: n. [化学] 分子；微小颗粒，微粒

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；专利证；专利品 adj. 专利的；特许生产或销售的；显著的；公开的；（脉管等）开放的 v. 取得……的专利权；授予专利

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: physics
trans: n. 物理学；物理现象

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: theory
trans: n. 理论；原理；学说；推测

sentences.english: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

name: universe
trans: n. 宇宙；世界；领域

sentences.english: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

name: blackout
trans: n. 灯火管制；灯火熄灭；暂时的意识丧失

sentences.english: ...blackout curtains.
sentences.chinese: …灯火管制时用的窗帘。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灯火管制；灯火熄灭；暂时的意识丧失
detailed_translations.english: a period during a war when all the lights in a town or city must be turned off

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉 vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售 vi. 献祭；奉献

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: disappear
trans: vi. 消失；失踪；不复存在 vt. 使…不存在；使…消失

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: navigator
trans: n. 航海家；领航员；驾驶员

sentences.english: That first citation is from 1557 and comes to us from a great navigator and map maker of the time.
sentences.chinese: 这第一条引证出自1557年，而且它还将一位当时伟大的航海家和地理绘图者带入我们的视野。

name: patchy
trans: adj. 零散的；分布不匀的；不完整的；参差不齐的；局部地区的；不很可靠的，不很令人满意的

sentences.english: patchy fog
sentences.chinese: 局部弥漫的雾气

detailed_translations.chinese: 不调和的；拼凑成的；有补丁的

name: pilot
trans: n. 飞行员；领航员 adj. 试点的 v. 驾驶；领航；试用 n. (Pilot)人名；(意、印)皮洛特；(法)皮洛

sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

detailed_translations.english: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: telegram
trans: n. 电报 vt. 用电报发送 vi. 发电报

sentences.english: The president received a briefing by telegram.
sentences.chinese: 总裁收到了一份电报简报。

detailed_translations.english: a message sent by telegraph

name: abdomen
trans: n. 腹部；下腹；腹腔

sentences.english: He went into the hospital to undergo tests for a pain in his abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 他去了医院接受对他的腹部疼痛进行的各项检查。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body between your chest and legs which contains your stomach,  bowel s  etc

name: colony
trans: n. 殖民地；移民队；种群；动物栖息地

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: larvae
trans: n. 幼虫，幼体（larva 的复数）

sentences.english: In fact, the animal uses its middle finger to find and harvest insect larvae in trees.
sentences.chinese: 实际上， 这种动物用其中指搜索和俘获藏在树木里的昆虫幼虫。

sentences.english: FLATOW: ...thank you, in their beaks, and poke in to pull out these larvae out of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 傅拉托：对，...谢谢你，是用它们的"喙"(鸟嘴)，把树枝戳进洞里去，把幼虫从树洞里钓出来。

sentences.english: We know that freshwater eels reproduce in the ocean because larvae have been found drifting near the surface thousands of miles from any shore.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道淡水鳗鱼在海里繁殖，因为我们曾经在距所有海岸数千英里的海面发现过漂动的鳗鱼幼体。

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，干扰，妨碍；障碍物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: pupa
trans: n. [昆] 蛹 n. (Pupa)人名；(意)普帕

name: thorax
trans: n. [解剖] 胸，胸膛；胸腔

name: crisis
trans: n. 危机；危险期；决定性时刻 adj. 危机的；用于处理危机的

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

name: duplicate
trans: vt. 复制；使加倍 n. 副本；复制品 adj. 复制的；二重的 vi. 复制；重复

sentences.english: A duplicate copy should be made for the county record office.
sentences.chinese: 应该制作一个副本呈交县档案室。

sentences.english: a duplicate key
sentences.chinese: 配制的钥匙

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的， 复制的
detailed_translations.english: exactly the same as something, or made as an exact copy of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的东西，复制品
detailed_translations.english: an exact copy of something that you can use in the same way

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制， 复印； 重复
detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly

name: insurance
trans: n. 保险；保险费；保险契约；赔偿金

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: vault
trans: n. 拱顶；撑竿跳；地下室 vi. 跳跃；成穹状弯曲 vt. 做成圆拱形；撑竿跳过

sentences.english: The robber vaulted over the counter and took $200 in cash.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫犯跃过柜台，抢走了200美元现金。

detailed_translations.english: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church
to jump over something in one movement, using your hands or a pole to help you

name: cast
trans: vt. 投，抛；计算；浇铸；投射（光、影、视线等） n. 投掷，抛；铸件，[古生] 铸型；演员阵容；脱落物 vi. 投，抛垂钓鱼钩；计算，把几个数字加起来 n. (Cast)人名；(法)卡斯特

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
detailed_translations.english: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

name: ceramic
trans: adj. 陶瓷的；陶器的；制陶艺术的 n. 陶瓷；陶瓷制品

sentences.english: This takes a little while to switch all of your plastic storage containers over to ceramic, glass or stainless steel but its definitely worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的塑料存储容器换成陶瓷的，玻璃的，或者不锈钢的你会浪费你一点时间。 但这绝对是值得的。

sentences.english: ...ceramic tiles.
sentences.chinese: …瓷砖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陶瓷的；陶器的；制陶艺术的

detailed_translations.english: Ceramic is clay that has been heated to a very high temperature so that it becomes hard

name: kiln
trans: n. （砖，石灰等的）窑；炉；干燥炉 v. 烧窑；在干燥炉干燥

sentences.english: They are charring wood in a kiln.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在窑内将木头烧成木炭。

sentences.english: That morning we fired our first kiln of charcoal.
sentences.chinese: 那天上午，我们烧了我们的第一窑木炭。

sentences.english: CRAFT SUPPLIES: Whether it’s small items like yarn or big items like a kiln, craft hobbies don’t have to be hard on your wallet.
sentences.chinese: 手工艺品： 无论是小到像纱这样的东西，还是大到像窑这样的东西，对于手工艺的兴趣不会让你为荷包发愁。

detailed_translations.english: a special oven for baking clay pots, bricks etc

name: loom
trans: v. 赫然耸现，可怕地出现；显得突出，逼近；（不祥之事）似将发生；在织布机上织 n. 织布机；若隐若现的景象 n. (Loom) （瑞典）洛姆（人名）

sentences.english: Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.
sentences.chinese: 文森特赫然出现在我面前，脸色苍白阴沉得像块墓碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 织布机；若隐若现的景象
detailed_translations.english: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见
detailed_translations.english: to appear as a large unclear shape, especially in a threatening way

name: mosaic
trans: n. 马赛克；镶嵌画般的东西；不同要素组合体；（电视摄像机的）感光镶嵌板面；（生）嵌合体；花叶病 v. 用马赛克装饰；整合 adj. （生）镶嵌性的；拼成的；摩西的 n. (Mosaic) （印、美）摩塞克（人名）

sentences.english: rooms decorated with wall paintings and mosaics
sentences.chinese: 用壁画和马赛克装饰的房间

sentences.english: a 3rd-century Roman mosaic floor
sentences.chinese: 三世纪罗马镶嵌地面

detailed_translations.chinese: 摩西的；拼成的；嵌花式的

detailed_translations.english: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc

name: mural
trans: n. 壁画 adj. （似）墙的，与墙有关的；（与）体腔壁有关的

sentences.english: Pour a little glue into some shallow containers, dip cotton balls in the glue and then stick onto the paper - you have a snow mural!
sentences.chinese: 在一个浅的容器里倒一点胶水，用棉球沾点胶水然后粘到纸上——你就有了幅雪景壁饰！

sentences.english: This work is clearly connected with The Last Supper: the Christ has the same ethereal and elusive quality as the faded figure at the centre of Leonardo's sublime mural.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画显然和《最后的晚餐》有某种关联：画中的基督，和达·芬奇最伟大的壁画中心那已褪色的基督形象一样，同样空灵缥缈。

detailed_translations.english: a painting that is painted on a wall, either inside or outside a building

name: antennae
trans: n. [电讯] 天线（等于aerial）；[昆] 触须；[植] 蕊喙；直觉

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染 vt. 传达；感染；显露

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: insect
trans: n. 昆虫；卑鄙的人

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

name: sensor
trans: n. 传感器

sentences.english: The latest Japanese vacuum cleaners contain sensors that detect the amount of dust and type of floor.
sentences.chinese: 日本最新款吸尘器装有传感器，能测出灰尘量和地板类型。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc

name: ebb
trans: n. 衰退；退潮；衰落 vi. 衰退；减少；衰落；潮退

sentences.english: His confidence is at a low ebb.
sentences.chinese: 他的信心很低落。

detailed_translations.english: the flow of the sea away from the shore, when the tide goes out
if the tide ebbs, it flows away from the shore

name: echolocation
trans: n. 回波定位；回声测距；回声定位能力（鲸和蝙蝠等所具备得一种机能）

sentences.english: Most bats navigate by echolocation.
sentences.chinese: 大多数蝙蝠通过回声定位飞行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回波定位；回声测距；回声定位能力（鲸和蝙蝠等所具备得一种机能）
detailed_translations.english: Echolocation is a system used by some animals to determine the position of an object by measuring how long it takes for an echo to return from the object

name: pup
trans: n. 小狗；幼畜 vt. 生（小狗等小动物） vi. 生小狗

sentences.english: a spaniel pup
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬幼崽

sentences.english: a litter of pups
sentences.chinese: 一窝小狗

detailed_translations.english: a young dog

name: rabies
trans: n. [内科] 狂犬病，恐水病

sentences.english: More than 99% of all human deaths from rabies occur in Africa and Asia.
sentences.chinese: 狂犬病造成的所有人类死亡中，有99%以上发生在非洲和亚洲。

sentences.english: Therefore, prompt local treatment of all bite wounds and scratches that may be contaminated with rabies virus is important.
sentences.chinese: 因此，迅速对可能已感染狂犬病毒的所有咬伤处和抓伤处进行局部处理很重要。

sentences.english: Becky found a wolf in the oak stump near the wash.I think it has rabies.
sentences.chinese: 贝基在干河床附近的栎树墩发现一只狼。 我想它有狂犬病。

detailed_translations.english: a very dangerous disease that affects dogs and other animals, and that you can catch if you are bitten by an infected animal

name: secluded
trans: adj. 隐蔽的；隐退的，隐居的 v. 隔绝（seclude的过去式）

sentences.english: He’s 80 years old now and lives a very secluded life.
sentences.chinese: 他现在80岁了，过着远离尘嚣的生活。

detailed_translations.english: very private and quiet

name: snout
trans: n. 鼻子；猪嘴；烟草；鼻口部；口吻状物

sentences.english: Two alligators rest their snouts on the water's surface.
sentences.chinese: 两只鳄鱼把它们的大嘴栖息在水面上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼻子；猪嘴；烟草；鼻口部；口吻状物
detailed_translations.english: the long nose of some kinds of animals, such as pigs

name: furious
trans: adj. 激烈的；狂怒的；热烈兴奋的；喧闹的

sentences.english: She was absolutely furious .
sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

name: obsidian
trans: n. 黑曜石

sentences.english: The Texas show includes an obsidian mask that likely traveled to Khara Khorum all the way from Egypt, Lessem says.
sentences.chinese: 德克萨斯州展出包括了一个黑曜石面具，可能是从埃及被带到哈喇和林来的，莱塞姆说。

detailed_translations.english: a type of rock that looks like black glass

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查 vi. 研究；调查 vt. 研究；调查 [ 过去式 researched 过去分词 researched 现在分词 researching ]

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: search engine
trans: 搜索引擎

name: volcanic
trans: adj. 火山的；猛烈的；易突然发作的 n. 火山岩

sentences.english: black volcanic sand
sentences.chinese: 黑色的火山砂

detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by a volcano

name: gross
trans: adj. 总共的；粗野的；恶劣的；显而易见的；恶心的 vt. 总共收入 n. 总额，总数 n. (Gross)人名；(英、法、德、意、葡、西、俄、芬、罗、捷、匈)格罗斯

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: net
trans: n. 网；有专门用途的网；球门网；球网；网络（等于 Internet）；（板球）练球场；（板球）一次练球；捕鱼总量；网眼织物；陷阱；候选人的选择面 adj. 纯的；最后的；原价的；（重量）净的；（高尔夫球得分）净得的 v. 净赚；用网捕；（巧妙地）捕获，得到；（将球）踢入球门；用网覆盖；使（某人）获得（利益、收入）；（计算时）扣除……（以得出净额） adv. 净地；净赚地 n. (Net) （俄）内（人名）

sentences.english: We netted three fish in under an hour.
sentences.chinese: 不到一小时我们就网住了三条鱼。

detailed_translations.english: to catch sth, especially fish, in a net

name: profit
trans: n. 利润；利益 vi. vi. 获利；有益 vt. 有益于 n. (Profit)（法）普罗菲（人名）

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: tactic
trans: n. 策略，战略 adj. 按顺序的，依次排列的

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

name: discouraged
trans: adj. 灰心的，丧气的 v. 使……灰心；（试图）阻止；劝阻（discourage 的过去式和过去分词）

name: gambler
trans: n. 赌徒；投机商人

sentences.english: There was a fellow in that casino tonight who's a very heavy gambler.
sentences.chinese: 今晚那家赌场有个家伙是个嗜赌成性的赌棍。

detailed_translations.english: A gambler is someone who gambles regularly, for example in card games or on horse racing

trans: n. 狂热；狂躁；热衷 n. (Mania)人名；(罗、阿拉伯、西)马尼亚

sentences.chinese: 恐龙热兴起于19世纪晚期。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医]颠狂, 狂躁, 癖好, 狂热
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

name: sustainable
trans: adj. 可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的；可持续的

sentences.english: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。

sentences.english: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
sentences.chinese: 雨林资源的可持续利用

sentences.english: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。

sentences.english: environmentally sustainable development
sentences.chinese: 生态环境的可持续发展

detailed_translations.english: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

name: garnish
trans: v. 装饰（尤指食物）；（为合法扣押属于债务人或被告的钱财）传讯（第三方） n. （为增加色香味而添加的）配菜，装饰品 n. (Garnish) （美、英）加尼什（人名）

sentences.english: She had finished the vegetables and was garnishing the roast.
sentences.chinese: 她已经做好了蔬菜，正给烤肉配饰菜。

detailed_translations.english: to add something to food in order to decorate it

detailed_translations.chinese: 为增加色香味而添加的配菜；装饰品
detailed_translations.english: a small amount of food such as salad or fruit that you place on food to decorate it

name: impetuous
trans: adj. 冲动的；鲁莽的；猛烈的

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，爱好；利息；利益；趣味；同行 vt. 使……感兴趣；引起……的关心；使……参与

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: invest
trans: vt. 投资；覆盖；耗费；授予；包围 vi. 投资，入股；花钱买

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

name: loan
trans: n. 贷款；借款 vi. 借出 vt. 借；借给

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

name: terms
trans: n. 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式） v. 把…称为（term的三单形式）

sentences.chinese: 心肌梗塞是心脏病发作的医学术语。

sentences.english: He had been termed a temporary employee.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被称为临时工。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式）
detailed_translations.english: A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject
If you say that something is termed a particular thing, you mean that that is what people call it or that is their opinion of it

name: Catholic
trans: adj. 天主教的；宽宏大量的 n. 天主教徒；罗马天主教

sentences.english: ...the Catholic Church.
sentences.chinese: …天主教会。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Roman Catholic Church
a member of the Catholic Church

name: dictator
trans: n. 独裁者；命令者

sentences.english: the downfall of the hated dictator
sentences.chinese: 遭人痛恨的独裁者的垮台

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force

name: highlands
trans: n. 高原地区；山岳地带（highland的复数形式）

name: plantation
trans: n. 栽植；殖民；大农场 adj. 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

sentences.english: a rubber plantation
sentences.chinese: 橡胶园

detailed_translations.chinese: 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

name: plateau
trans: n. 高原；稳定水平；托盘；平顶女帽 vi. 达到平衡；达到稳定时期

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: sugarcane
trans: n. [作物] 甘蔗；糖蔗

sentences.english: The sugared vinegar is refined from the sugarcane and pine.
sentences.chinese: 加糖的醋是从甘蔗和松木中精炼出来的。

sentences.english: There are vast fields of sugarcane in Queensland, Australia.
sentences.chinese: 在澳大利亚昆士兰州有大片甘蔗田。

sentences.english: Plant waxes include carnauba wax candelilla wax and sugarcane wax used in polishes. About90% of the waxes in commerce are recovered by dewaxing petroleum.
sentences.chinese: 植物蜡主要是巴西棕榈蜡，小烛树蜡和甘蔗蜡都用作擦亮剂。工业用蜡中约有90%是由石油中回收的。

detailed_translations.english: a tall tropical plant from whose stems sugar is obtained

name: contract
trans: n. 合同，契约；婚约；（非正式）暗杀协议；（桥牌）定约 v. 收缩，缩短；感染；订约；订（婚）；负（债）；结交

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: disband
trans: vi. 解散 vt. 解散；遣散

sentences.english: All the armed groups will be disbanded.
sentences.chinese: 所有武装团体将被解散。

detailed_translations.english: to stop existing as an organization, or to make something do this

name: fierce
trans: adj. 凶猛的；猛烈的；暴躁的 n. (Fierce)人名；(英)菲尔斯

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: regiment
trans: n. （军事单位）团；大量的人；统治，管辖 v. 对……严格管制；把（部队）编成团

sentences.english: the regimented routine of boarding school
sentences.chinese: 寄宿学校严格的生活规律

detailed_translations.english: to organize and control people firmly and usually too strictly
a large group of soldiers, usually consisting of several  battalion s

name: reputation
trans: n. 名声，名誉；声望

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: starvation
trans: n. 饿死；挨饿；绝食

sentences.english: people dying of starvation
sentences.chinese: 快饿死的人们

detailed_translations.english: suffering or death caused by lack of food

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: democracy
trans: n. 民主，民主主义；民主政治

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
sentences.chinese: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权 n. (Heritage)人名；(英)赫里蒂奇

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: parliament
trans: n. 议会，国会

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

name: province
trans: n. 省；领域；职权

sentences.english: Computers were once the exclusive province of scientists and mathematicians.
sentences.chinese: 计算机一度为科学家和数学家专用。

detailed_translations.english: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: disguise
trans: vt. 掩饰；假装；隐瞒 n. 伪装；假装；用作伪装的东西

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.

trans: vt. 使吓一跳；使惊奇 vi. 惊吓；惊跳；惊奇 n. 惊愕；惊恐

sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我不是故意吓你一跳的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: check
trans: vt. 检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾；托运 vi. 核实，查核；中止；打勾；[象棋]将一军 n. 支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对 n. （英）切克（人名）

sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: descend
trans: vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊 vt. 下去；沿…向下

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

trans: n. 旅客；乘客；过路人；碍手碍脚的人

sentences.chinese: 司机和乘客均未受伤。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is travelling in a vehicle, plane, boat etc, but is not driving it or working on it

name: transport
trans: n. 运输；运输机；狂喜；流放犯 vt. 运输；流放；使狂喜

sentences.chinese: 运输石油的卡车

sentences.english: Canals were used for the transport of goods.
sentences.chinese: 利用运河来运输货物。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, people etc from one place to another in a vehicle
the process or business of taking goods from one place to another

name: turbulence
trans: n. 骚乱，动荡；[流] 湍流；狂暴

trans: n. 困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

name: disoriented
trans: adj. 分不清方向或目标的；无判断力的 v. 使……迷惑（disorient 的过去式和过去分词）

name: junction
trans: n. 连接，接合；交叉点；接合点

sentences.english: the junction of Abbot Road and Mill Street
sentences.chinese: 阿伯特路与米尔街的交叉口

sentences.english: Junction 5 on the M40
sentences.chinese: 40号高速公路上的第5交叉口

detailed_translations.english: a place where one road, track etc joins another

name: labyrinth
trans: n. 迷宫；[解剖] 迷路；难解的事物

sentences.chinese: …迷宫般的走廊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷宫；[解剖] 迷路；难解的事物
detailed_translations.english: a large network of paths or passages which cross each other, making it very difficult to find your way

trans: n. 杰作；绝无仅有的人

sentences.english: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

detailed_translations.english: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

name: strategy
trans: n. 战略，策略

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

trans: adj. 土著的；原始的 n. 土著居民；土生生物

name: Australia
trans: n. 澳大利亚，澳洲

sentences.chinese: 他把家迁到澳大利亚。

sentences.english: He went out to Australia about five years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他大约在五年前移居澳大利亚。

sentences.english: Australia won the toss and put England in to bat.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队掷币获胜，要求英格兰队首先击球。

name: celebrity
trans: n. 名人；名声

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

trans: n. 记录，记载；唱片；（过去的）经历，履历；纪录，最佳成绩；前科，犯罪记录 v. 记录，记载；录制；发表正式声明；（仪器）标明，显示；取得（成就） adj. 创纪录的 n. (Record) （美）勒科尔（人名）

sentences.english: According to official records, five people were killed last year near that road junction.
sentences.chinese: 据官方记录，去年有五人在那个路口附近丧生。

sentences.chinese: 他的经历说明他个性坚强。

sentences.chinese: 她丈夫要她把花的每分钱都记下来。

to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future

name: tribe
trans: n. 部落；族；宗族；一伙 n. (Tribe)人名；(英)特赖布

sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

detailed_translations.english: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

trans: n. 圣歌；赞美诗 vt. 唱；诵扬 vi. 唱歌；反复地唱歌 n. (Chant)人名；(英)钱特

sentences.chinese: …一首格列高利圣歌。

detailed_translations.english: a regularly repeated tune, often with many words sung on one note, especially used for religious prayers

sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: squad
trans: n. 班；小队；五人组（篮球队的非正式说法） vt. 把…编成班；把…编入班

sentences.chinese: 操练小队

detailed_translations.chinese: 班；小队；五人组（篮球队的非正式说法）

sentences.chinese: 作为一种宣传噱头，托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics

detailed_translations.chinese: 阻碍…的正常生长或发展

name: synchronized
trans: adj. 同步的；同步化的 v. 使协调（synchronize的过去分词）；同时发生；校准

sentences.chinese: 比如困难之一就是：每当我们的眼球移动时，视网膜上的影像也在移动。

sentences.chinese: 感觉神经元,负责收集外界信息,比如,当你看到我的时候,视网膜上的神经元会产生神经冲动,将刺激信号传递到你的大脑

sentences.english: ...a small package wrapped in tissue paper.
sentences.chinese: …一个小包裹，用薄棉纸包着。

sentences.english: As we age we lose muscle tissue.
sentences.chinese: 随着年纪的增大，我们会失去一些肌肉组织。

sentences.chinese: 阳光由波长不同的射线组成。

detailed_translations.english: the size of a radio wave used to broadcast a radio signal

sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的

sentences.chinese: 在有些地方大沙丘使得靠近海滩很难。

detailed_translations.english: a hill made of sand near the sea or in the desert

sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

trans: n. 灌溉；[临床] 冲洗；冲洗法

sentences.chinese: 运河的小堵塞或倒塌都会阻塞整个负责的灌溉网络。

sentences.chinese: 与之相比，美国全年41%的水投向了农业，并几乎全都用在了灌溉上。

sentences.chinese: 喷洒灌溉，喷灌把水喷洒于准备种植作物的土地上。常常使用经过污水厂处理过的废水。

sentences.chinese: ...一个饲养牛和骆驼的游牧国家。

trans: n. 绿洲；舒适的地方；令人宽慰的事物 n. (Oasis)人名；(英)奥西斯

sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

trans: n. 解剖；解剖学；剖析；骨骼

sentences.chinese: 解剖学教授

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速 adj. 作为毕生职业的 vi. 全速前进，猛冲

sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

trans: adj. 决定了的；坚决的 v. 决定；断定（determine的过去分词）

sentences.chinese: 格温是个意志很坚定的女性。

detailed_translations.english: having a strong desire to do something, so that you will not let anyone stop you

name: graduation
trans: n. 毕业；毕业典礼；刻度，分度；分等级

sentences.chinese: 尼尔毕业以后回到了俄亥俄州。

sentences.english: On graduation (= after completing a first degree ) , Nancy became an art teacher.
sentences.chinese: 南希毕业以后当了一名美术老师。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毕业；毕业典礼；刻度，分度；分等级
detailed_translations.english: the time when you complete a university degree course or your education at an American  high school

name: physician
trans: n. 医师，内科医师；抚慰者

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: reject
trans: vt. 拒绝；排斥；抵制；丢弃 n. 被弃之物或人；次品

sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: ancient
trans: adj. 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的 n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: cylinder
trans: n. 圆筒；汽缸；[数] 柱面；圆柱状物

sentences.chinese: 气体储存在圆筒内。

sentences.english: a four-cylinder engine
sentences.chinese: 四汽缸引擎

detailed_translations.english: a shape, object, or container with circular ends and long straight sides

name: percussion
trans: n. [临床] 叩诊；振动；碰撞；敲打乐器；打击乐器组

sentences.english: Tonight we have Paul Duke on percussion (= playing a percussion instrument ) .
sentences.chinese: 今晚我们请到保罗·杜克先生负责打击乐。

sentences.english: a range of percussion instruments
sentences.chinese: 一组打击乐器

detailed_translations.english: musical instruments such as drums, bells etc which you play by hitting them

name: rhythm
trans: n. 节奏；韵律

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: earthquake
trans: n. 地震；大动荡

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

name: fault

sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

name: tsunami
trans: n. 海啸

sentences.english: You see this in the faces of tsunami and earthquake survivors on television.
sentences.chinese: 你能从电视上海啸和地震的生还者的脸上看到这点。

sentences.english: They urged other town residents unaffected by the quake and tsunami to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 他们敦促其他没有受到地震和海啸影响的城镇居民也这样做。

sentences.english: But I am lucky because we did get a little bit of the tsunami but nothing like what they got up north.
sentences.chinese: 但我算是幸运的因为我们这只受到了海啸很小的侵害远不及北方所受到的那样。

detailed_translations.english: a very large wave, caused by extreme conditions such as an  earthquake  , which can cause a lot of damage when it reaches land

name: volcano
trans: n. 火山

sentences.english: Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
sentences.chinese: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

detailed_translations.english: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava is sometimes forced out

name: descendant
trans: n. 后裔，子孙；（由过去类似物发展来的）派生物；（机器等）后继型产品 adj. 下降的；祖传的

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: economy
trans: n. 经济；节约；理财 n. (Economy)人名；(英)伊科诺米

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: exhausted
trans: adj. 筋疲力尽的，疲惫不堪的；耗尽的，枯竭的 v. 使……精疲力尽；耗尽，用尽；详尽讨论（exhaust 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: You look absolutely exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 你看上去一副疲惫不堪的样子。

sentences.english: Don't exhaust him.
sentences.chinese: 别让他精疲力竭了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely tired

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽；用尽；使…精疲力尽（exhaust的过去式）
detailed_translations.english: If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left

name: persecution
trans: n. 迫害；烦扰

sentences.english: ...the persecution of minorities.
sentences.chinese: …对少数派的迫害。

sentences.english: ...victims of political persecution.
sentences.chinese: …政治迫害的受害者。

detailed_translations.english: Persecution is cruel and unfair treatment of a person or group, especially because of their religious or political beliefs, or their race

name: venture
trans: n. 冒险旅行；（有风险的）企业 v. 敢于冒险；小心地说（或做）；冒着失去……的风险 n. (Venture) （法）旺蒂尔（人名）

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: audience
trans: n. 观众；听众；读者；接见；正式会见；拜会

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: contestant
trans: n. 竞争者；争辩者

sentences.english: Column 5 displays only one contestant—the winner of the entire tournament.
sentences.chinese: 第 5 列只显示了一个竞争者 — 整个锦标赛的获胜者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in a contest

name: international
trans: adj. 国际的；国际通用的 n. 国际体育比赛（选手）；外国人 n. (International) 共产国际（组织）

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: lyrics
trans: n. 歌词；抒情诗（lyric的复数）

sentences.english: ...Kurt Weill's Broadway opera with lyrics by Langston Hughes.
sentences.chinese: …由兰斯顿·休斯作词的库尔特·韦尔的百老汇歌剧。

detailed_translations.english: The lyrics of a song are its words

name: trophy
trans: n. 奖品；战利品；纪念品 vt. 用战利品装饰 adj. 显示身份的；有威望的 n. (Trophy)人名；(法)特罗菲

sentences.english: A lion’s head was among the trophies of his African trip.
sentences.chinese: 他非洲之行的战利品之一是个狮头。

detailed_translations.english: something that you keep to prove your success in something, especially in war or hunting

name: cunning
trans: adj. 狡猾的；巧妙的；可爱的 n. 狡猾

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: demigod
trans: n. 受崇拜的人，英雄人物；半神半人；小神

name: immortality
trans: n. 不朽；不朽的声名；不灭

sentences.english: the immortality of the soul
sentences.chinese: 灵魂的不朽

detailed_translations.english: the state of living for ever or being remembered for ever

name: mythical
trans: adj. 神话的；虚构的

sentences.english: a mythical creature like the Minotaur
sentences.chinese: 像弥诺陶洛斯这类神话故事中的怪物

detailed_translations.english: existing only in an ancient story

name: Polynesian
trans: adj. 波利尼西亚的；波利尼西亚人的 n. 波利尼西亚人

sentences.english: Allegiance to chiefs was a fundamental of Polynesian culture.
sentences.chinese: 效忠首领是波利尼西亚人最基本的文化。

sentences.english: It is possible that Polynesian rats, arriving with human settlers, may have eaten enough seeds to help to decimate the trees.
sentences.chinese: 有可能是与人类共同达到该岛的波利尼西亚鼠类，吃掉了大量的种子促成了棕榈树的大批死亡。

sentences.english: Polynesian society blossomed in this unlikely locale after hardy souls somehow navigated a fleet of wooden outrigger canoes to this tiny speck in the vastness of the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 在一群勇敢的人们驾驶着一队独木舟来到广阔的太平洋上的这个小岛上，一个波利尼西亚社会开始在这个不可思议的位置繁荣了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 波利尼西亚人, 波利尼西亚语
detailed_translations.english: a member of the people that inhabit Polynesia, generally of Caucasoid features with light skin and wavy hair

name: snare
trans: n. （捕鸟、兽的）陷阱；圈套，骗局；（绷在小鼓下鼓皮的）响弦；（勒除息肉和增生）勒除器 v. 设陷阱（或罗网、套子）捕捉；诱捕（某人），使……上当

sentences.english: A rabbit was caught in the snare.
sentences.chinese: 一只兔子被套索套住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陷阱；圈套；[外科] 勒除器
detailed_translations.english: a trap for catching an animal, especially one that uses a wire or rope to catch the animal by its foot
to catch an animal by using a snare

name: generation
trans: n. 一代；产生；一代人；生殖

sentences.english: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.chinese: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.english: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.english: the generation of electricity
sentences.chinese: 发电

detailed_translations.english: all people of about the same age

name: menorah
trans: n. 犹太宗教仪式所用的烛台之一种

name: merriment
trans: n. 欢笑；嬉戏；欢庆

sentences.english: Her eyes sparkled with merriment.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼里闪现出愉快的神情。

sentences.english: the sounds of merriment
sentences.chinese: 嬉闹的声音

detailed_translations.english: laughter, fun, and enjoyment

name: ornament
trans: n. 装饰；[建][服装] 装饰物；教堂用品 vt. 装饰，修饰

sentences.english: a shelf covered with books and ornaments
sentences.chinese: 摆满书籍和装饰品的架子

sentences.english: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
sentences.chinese: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰品，点缀品；装饰，点缀
detailed_translations.english: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful

detailed_translations.chinese: 装饰， 点缀， 美化

name: tradition
trans: n. 惯例，传统；传说

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: arthropod
trans: n. 节肢动物 adj. 节肢动物的

sentences.english: The Japanese Spider Crab is the biggest arthropod on Earth--their legs are believed to grow up to 12 feet long.
sentences.chinese: 日本的蟹型蜘蛛是地球上最大的节肢动物，它们的腿被认为能够长到12英尺长。

sentences.english: We were hoping that was just a tiny trash can but, no, it's a coconut crab, which is the biggest arthropod that lives on land.
sentences.chinese: 我们本以为这是一个小小的垃圾桶，但是不，这是只椰子蟹，该物种是陆地上最大的节肢动物。

sentences.english: “Charlotte’s Web.” The story of the spider who saves her friend, the pig, is the kindest representation of an arthropod in literary history.
sentences.chinese: 《夏洛特的网》讲述了一只蜘蛛拯救她的猪朋友的故事，蜘蛛夏洛特成为文学史上最善良的节肢动物的代表。

detailed_translations.english: any invertebrate of the phylum Arthropoda, having jointed limbs, a segmented body, and an exoskeleton made of chitin

name: burrow
trans: v. 挖地洞，挖通道；依偎；挖穿；钻入；（使）……钻到……下面；（在……里）搜寻；深入查询 n. （动物的，尤指兔子挖的）洞穴，地洞 n. (Burrow) （美）伯罗（人名）

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: erosion
trans: n. 侵蚀，腐蚀

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

name: jetty
trans: n. 码头；防波堤 adj. 乌黑发亮的，煤玉似的 vi. 伸出

detailed_translations.english: a wide wall or flat area built out into the water, used for getting on and off boats
of or resembling jet, esp in colour or polish

name: molt
trans: vi. 脱毛；换毛 n. 换毛；脱皮；换毛期 vt. 脱毛；换毛 n. (Molt)人名；(德、捷)莫尔特

sentences.english: Like other penguins, it undergoes an annual molt, replacing all its feathers in a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 和其他企鹅一样，它也经历一年一次的脱毛，在几周时间里替换掉所有的羽毛。

sentences.english: He said emperor penguins can spend months at a time in the ocean, coming ashore only to molt or rest, but did not know what might have caused this particular one to become disoriented.
sentences.chinese: 他说帝企鹅可以一次性在海里带上数月，上岸只是为了脱毛换羽和休息。 但不知道是什么造成了这只特别的企鹅变得分不清楚方向。

name: germ
trans: n. [植] 胚芽，萌芽；细菌 vi. 萌芽

sentences.english: Put disinfectant down the toilet to kill any germs.
sentences.chinese: 在抽水马桶里投放消毒剂杀菌。

sentences.english: germ cells containing DNA
sentences.chinese: 含DNA的生殖细胞

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that can make you ill

name: influenza
trans: n. [内科] 流行性感冒（简写flu）；家畜流行性感冒

sentences.english: All the medical workers in the region helped to put down the influenza epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的所有医务工作者参加了消灭流行性感冒的工作。

sentences.english: People should therefore continue to seek seasonal influenza vaccination like any other year.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人们应当像以往一样继续接种季节性流感疫苗。

detailed_translations.english: an infectious disease that is like a very bad cold

name: mutate
trans: vi. 变化，产生突变 vt. 改变，使突变

sentences.english: Simple organisms like bacteria mutate rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 像细菌那样的简单有机体突变的速度很快。

detailed_translations.english: if an animal or plant mutates, it becomes different from others of the same kind, because of a change in its  genetic  structure

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗；牛痘苗 adj. 疫苗的；牛痘的

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: virus
trans: n. [病毒] 病毒；恶毒；毒害 n. (Virus)人名；(西)比鲁斯

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

name: determination
trans: n. 决心；果断；测定

sentences.english: his dogged determination (= very strong determination ) to succeed
sentences.chinese: 他想要成功的坚定决心

detailed_translations.english: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: grit
trans: n. 砂砾；勇气，决心；粗砂岩 v. 在……上铺砂砾；咬紧牙关；吱嘎吱嘎地移动 n. (Grit) （美、法、荷）格里特（人名）

sentences.english: If they gave gold medals for grit, Karen would be right up there on the winners' podium.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们颁发毅力金牌，卡伦应该站在领奖台上。

detailed_translations.english: determination and courage
to scatter grit on a frozen road to make it less slippery

name: Olympic
trans: adj. 奥林匹克的；奥林匹斯山的，奥林匹亚的

sentences.english: an Olympic gold medal
sentences.chinese: 奥运会金牌

detailed_translations.chinese: 奥林匹斯山的，奥林匹亚的；奥林匹克的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Olympic Games

name: track
trans: n. 轨道；足迹，踪迹；小道 vt. 追踪；通过；循路而行；用纤拉 vi. 追踪；走；留下足迹

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: app
trans: abbr. （计算机）应用程序 (application) n. (App) （美、德、巴）阿普（人名）

name: creativity
trans: n. 创造力；创造性

sentences.english: artistic creativity
sentences.chinese: 艺术创造力

sentences.english: Teachers have been attacked for stifling creativity in their pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师被批评压抑了学生的创造力。

sentences.english: Editors complain about the lack of creativity in the ideas put to them.
sentences.chinese: 编辑们抱怨说交给他们的选题缺乏创意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to use your imagination to produce new ideas, make things etc

name: device
trans: n. 装置；策略；图案；设备；终端

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: invent
trans: vt. 发明；创造；虚构

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: isthmus
trans: n. 地峡；管峡

name: landform
trans: n. [地理] 地形

sentences.english: This small country has an amazing variety of landforms.
sentences.chinese: 这个小国家拥有令人惊叹的丰富的地貌类型。

sentences.english: ...glacial land forms.
sentences.chinese: ...冰川地貌。

detailed_translations.english: A landform is any natural feature of the Earth's surface, such as a hill, a lake, or a beach

name: peninsula
trans: n. 半岛

sentences.english: the Korean peninsula
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜半岛

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land almost completely surrounded by water but joined to a large area of land

name: airship
trans: n. 飞艇

name: blimp
trans: n. 顽固的保守分子；软式小型飞船；隔音罩

name: density
trans: n. 密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: dirigible
trans: adj. 可驾驶的 n. 飞船

name: gas
trans: n. 气体；[矿业] 瓦斯；汽油；毒气 vt. 加油；毒（死） vi. 加油；放出气体；空谈 n. (Gas)人名；(法、德、西)加斯

sentences.english: hydrogen gas
sentences.chinese: 氢气

sentences.english: Can you light the gas for me?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我点燃煤气好吗？

sentences.english: I probably spend over 200 a month on gas.
sentences.chinese: 我一个月大概要花200多美元汽油钱。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as air, which is not solid or liquid, and usually cannot be seen

name: zeppelin
trans: n. 齐柏林硬式飞艇

name: anxious
trans: adj. 焦虑的；担忧的；渴望的；急切的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: fascination
trans: n. 魅力；魔力；入迷

sentences.english: The fascination lay in the mystery of what was inside the box.
sentences.chinese: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

detailed_translations.english: something that interests you very much, or the quality of being very interesting

name: humiliation
trans: n. 丢脸，耻辱；蒙羞；谦卑

sentences.english: the humiliation of having to ask her parents for money
sentences.chinese: 不得不开口伸手向她父母要钱的难堪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of shame and great embarrassment, because you have been made to look stupid or weak

name: nominate
trans: vt. 推荐；提名；任命；指定

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: overwhelming
trans: adj. 压倒性的；势不可挡的 v. 压倒，淹没，制服（overwhelm 的现在分词）

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: arid
trans: adj. 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: barren
trans: adj. 贫瘠的；不生育的；无益的；沉闷无趣的；空洞的 n. 荒地 n. (Barren)人名；(西、英)巴伦

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago the surface was barren desert.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.english: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

name: dweller
trans: n. 居民，居住者

sentences.english: City dwellers suffer higher pollution levels.
sentences.chinese: 城市居民承受的污染程度更严重。

detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that lives in a particular place

name: bracket
trans: n. 支架，墙上凸出的托架；括号；等级，范围 vt. 括在一起；把…归入同一类；排除

sentences.english: I think you should bracket this word.
sentences.chinese: 我认为你应该给这个字加上括号。

sentences.english: So for example, tags like or must have a closing bracket as shown in Listing 8, taken from the above JSP.
sentences.chinese: 所以，例如，从上面的JSP接受的如或这样的标记必须有一个闭括号，如清单8 所示。

detailed_translations.english: one of the pair of signs ( ) put around words to show extra information
to consider two or more people or things as being similar or the same

name: dominant
trans: adj. 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的 n. 显性

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: underdog
trans: n. 比赛中不被看好者；失败者；受压迫者；斗败了的狗

sentences.english: Crowds often feel sympathy for the underdog.
sentences.chinese: 观众经常会同情弱者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛中不被看好者；失败者；受压迫者；斗败了的狗

name: unpredictability
trans: n. 不可预测性，不可预知性；不可预见性

sentences.english: The danger lies in its unpredictability. Yet that may also be a reason for hope.
sentences.chinese: 危险就在于其不可预测性，而这也可能是希望尚存的一个原因吧。

sentences.english: With the unpredictability of the volcano, authorities widened the danger zone around the mountain to 20 kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 鉴于这一火山的不可预测性，印尼官员将“危险区域”扩大到方圆20公里。

sentences.english: While the West views democracy as an advantage since it can offer United States an institutional and bloodless process for renewal, Beijing views it as a source of irrationality and unpredictability.
sentences.chinese: 尽管西方认为民主是一种优势，可以给美国提供一种制度上的、不流血的更新进程，但北京认为这是非理性和不可预测性的一个源头。

name: upset
trans: vt. 使心烦；颠覆；扰乱 vi. 翻倒 adj. 心烦的；混乱的；弄翻的 n. 混乱；翻倒；颠覆

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: canyon
trans: n. 峡谷

sentences.english: The canyon is famous for producing echoes.
sentences.chinese: 这个峡谷以回声而闻名。

sentences.english: The grand canyon was not dug by the hand of man, but riven by nature.
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷并非人力所开而是受大自然之力而成的。

sentences.english: We made our way up the fixed rope and then down into a deeper third canyon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着固定的绳索前进，然后到达了一个更深的峡谷，这已经是第三个了。

detailed_translations.english: a deep valley with very steep sides of rock that usually has a river running through it

name: mestizo
trans: n. 混血儿（尤指拉丁民族与印第安族的）

name: rainforest
trans: n. （热带）雨林

sentences.english: The rainforest is essential in other areas also.
sentences.chinese: 雨林在其他地区也是必不可少的。

sentences.english: The rainforest around our house sometimes brings forth intriguing creatures like this.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房子周围的雨林有时带来了这样有趣的生物。

sentences.english: Then we carried on in the worst conditions yet: low, tangled rainforest that blocked out the light, and mud up to our thighs.
sentences.chinese: 那时我们还在最糟糕的环境里行进着：低矮、纷乱的雨林遮住了阳光，泥浆没至我们的大腿。

name: counterfeiter
trans: n. [法] 伪造者；货币伪造者

name: currency
trans: n. 货币；通货

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: denomination
trans: n. 面额；名称；教派

sentences.english: Christians of all denominations
sentences.chinese: 各教派的基督徒

detailed_translations.english: a religious group that has different beliefs from other groups within the same religion

name: debris
trans: n. 碎片，残骸 n. (Debris)人名；(法)德布里

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: hammock
trans: n. 吊床；吊铺；吊带 vt. 睡吊床 n. (Hammock)人名；(英)哈莫克

sentences.english: Hang a hammock; lie in it.
sentences.chinese: 挂上一个吊床，然后躺在里面。

sentences.english: Many nights, I cried silently in my hammock, tears of self-pity streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 许多个晚上，我在吊床上静静地哭泣，自伤自怜的泪水顺着脸往下淌。

sentences.english: But when I started to read the journals that I'd written in my hammock each night, I realised that I'd been pretty miserable for large parts of the journey.
sentences.chinese: 但是当我开始阅读在旅行中我每个夜晚在吊床上写下的文字时，我才意识到，在这次旅程的大部分时间里，我都是倍受折磨和煎熬的。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of cloth that is hung between two trees or posts so that you can sleep in it

name: helm
trans: n. 舵；舵柄；领导地位；驾驶盘 vt. 指挥；给...掌舵 n. (Helm)人名；(英、瑞典)赫尔姆；(法)埃尔姆；(德、匈、捷)黑尔姆

sentences.english: After more than a decade at the helm of Colorado State University, Albert C Yates today announced his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 在掌管科罗拉多州立大学10多年后，阿尔伯特·叶慈于今天宣布退休。

detailed_translations.chinese: 舵；舵柄；领导地位；驾驶盘
detailed_translations.english: the wheel or control which guides a ship or boat
to direct or steer

name: navigate
trans: v. 导航；航行，驾驶；找到正确的应对方法；（在互联网上）浏览；（艰难地）走过；（尤指穿过人群）带人找路

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

name: refuse
trans: v. 拒绝，回绝；拒绝给，拒绝接受；（物）未应要求其作用（非正式）；（旧）不接受（某人的）求婚；（马）拒绝跨（栏等障碍物） n. 垃圾，废弃物 adj. 废弃的

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: sound
trans: n. 声音；噪音；音响；海峡；听力范围；医用探子；无线电广播；音响效果 v. （使）发声；听起来；鸣警报；听（诊）；回响；探测；试探；宣告；（医）用探子检查；（尤指鲸鱼）潜入深海 adj. 合理的；无损的；有能力的；充足的；彻底的；熟睡的；资金充实的；（非正式）非常棒的；严厉的；健全的 adv. 彻底地，酣畅地

sentences.english: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.english: a sound knowledge of English
sentences.chinese: 扎实的英语知识

sentences.english: He has sound grasp of European history.
sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

detailed_translations.english: complete and thorough

name: convince
trans: vt. 说服；使确信，使信服

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: deadline
trans: n. 最终期限；（监狱范围的）死线

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

name: delivery
trans: n. [贸易] 交付；分娩；递送

sentences.english: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。

sentences.english: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。

sentences.english: fresh milk deliveries
sentences.chinese: 新鲜牛奶递送

sentences.english: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought

name: mistake
trans: n. 错误；误会；过失 vt. 弄错；误解 vi. 弄错；误解

sentences.english: The most common mistake is to plant them too deep.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的错误就是把它们种得太深了。

sentences.english: She mistook my meaning entirely.
sentences.chinese: 她完全误解了我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that has been done in the wrong way, or an opinion or statement that is incorrect
to understand something wrongly

name: route
trans: n. 路线，航线；道路，公路；（交通工具的）固定路线；巡访；途径，渠道；（北美）递送路线；用于美国干线公路号码前 v. 按特定路线发送，为……规定路线

sentences.english: Trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks.
sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere using a particular route
a way from one place to another

name: bewilderment
trans: n. 困惑；迷乱；慌张

name: commotion
trans: n. 骚动；暴乱

sentences.english: He heard a commotion outside.
sentences.chinese: 他听到外面一阵骚动。

detailed_translations.english: A commotion is a lot of noise, confusion, and excitement

name: humiliated
trans: v. （使）蒙羞，丢脸（humiliate 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 蒙羞的；感到自惭的

name: mock
trans: v. 嘲笑，（通过模仿）嘲弄；不尊重，蔑视；使显得可笑 adj. 虚假的，不诚实的；模拟的，仿制的 n. （非正式）英国模拟考试；笑柄；嘲笑；模仿，仿造（品） adv. 虚假地，不诚实地 n. (Mock) （美、德）莫克（人名）

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: persist
trans: vi. 存留，坚持；持续，固执 vt. 坚持说，反复说

sentences.english: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果一直痛，你就必须去看医生了。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

name: rowdy
trans: adj. 吵闹的；粗暴的 n. 粗暴的人；好吵闹的人 n. (Rowdy)人名；(英)罗迪

sentences.english: gangs of rowdy youths
sentences.chinese: 几伙吵闹的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a noisy rough way that is likely to cause arguments and fighting
someone who behaves in a rough noisy way

name: ban
trans: v. 禁止，取缔；（官方）把（某人）逐出某地 n. 禁止，禁令，禁忌；剥夺公民权的判决；诅咒；巴尼（罗马尼亚货币单位） n. (Ban) （美、罗马、克罗地亚）班恩（人名）

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: draft
trans: n. 汇票；草稿；选派；（尤指房间、烟囱、炉子等供暖系统中的）（小股）气流 vt. 起草；制定；征募 vi. 拟稿；绘样；作草图 adj. 初步画出或（写出）的；（设计、草图、提纲或版本）正在起草中的，草拟的；以草稿形式的；草图的

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

name: Islam
trans: n. 伊斯兰教 n. (Islam)人名；(阿拉伯、巴基、孟)伊斯兰

sentences.english: He converted to Islam at the age of 16.
sentences.chinese: 他在16岁时皈依了伊斯兰教。

detailed_translations.english: the Muslim religion, which was started by Muhammad and whose holy book is the Quran (Koran)

name: racism
trans: n. 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见

sentences.english: The government has promised to continue the fight against racism.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。

sentences.english: the problem of racism in schools
sentences.chinese: 学校里的种族歧视问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见
detailed_translations.english: unfair treatment of people, or violence against them, because they belong to a different race from your own

name: segregation
trans: n. 隔离，分离；种族隔离

sentences.english: The Supreme Court unanimously ruled that racial segregation in schools was unconstitutional.
sentences.chinese: 最高法院一致裁定学校实施的种族隔离措施违反宪法。

detailed_translations.english: when people of different races, sexes, or religions are kept apart so that they live, work, or study separately

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: eruption
trans: n. 爆发，喷发；火山灰；出疹

sentences.english: The last eruption of this volcano lasted over a year, so this cannot be ruled out.
sentences.chinese: 该火山上次爆发持续了一年，所以现在也不能排除这个可能性。

sentences.english: Our work was like that of geologists who compile the signs of an imminent earthquake or volcanic eruption.
sentences.chinese: 我们的工作如同地质学家，我们收集一场即将到来的地震或火山爆发的迹象。

sentences.english: If a volcanic eruption wipes out all of the plain mice, the island will be repopulated by striped mice.
sentences.chinese: 假设一次火山爆发消灭了所有的普通老鼠，那么这个小岛将是斑纹鼠的天下。

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: fresco
trans: n. 壁画 n. (Fresco)人名；(英、意、西、葡)弗雷斯科

sentences.english: The medium of fresco makes great demands on a painter's techinical skill.
sentences.chinese: 壁画这种绘画形式对画家的技巧有很高要求。

sentences.english: We show this in a scene in the Sistine Chapel [in Rome] where we create a big crack in the fresco of God and Adam.
sentences.chinese: 我们将这个观点放到了发生在罗马西斯廷教堂的一幕里——一幅绘有上帝与亚当的壁画发生严重断裂。

sentences.english: Today, much of it is occupied by government offices and only vestiges of its beauty endure – admittedly including Gozzoli's fresco of the journey of the Magi.
