trans: adj. 无形的，看不见的；无形的；不显眼的，暗藏的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: lens
trans: n. 透镜，镜头；眼睛中的水晶体；晶状体；隐形眼镜；汽车的灯玻璃 vt. 给……摄影

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

name: microorganism
trans: n. [微] 微生物；微小动植物

sentences.english: This is actually just a microorganism. But it has roughly 500 genes.
sentences.chinese: 这其实只不过是一个微生物，却拥有约500个基因。

sentences.english: Spread the contents of the amber onto a petri dish containing a microorganism food like starch or soy.
sentences.chinese: 把琥珀内嵌标本放在皮氏培养皿中，并加入微生物食品，比如淀粉或大豆。

sentences.english: Slight mutations that allow a microorganism to resist the full killing power of a medicine are an evolutionary advantage that greatly expedites the development of drug resistance.
sentences.chinese: 略微的突变即可使微生物具有抵抗力，使药物完全失去杀伤力，这种突变是一个进化优势，大大加快了耐药性的产生。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that is so small that it cannot be seen without a  microscope

name: microscope
trans: n. 显微镜

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

name: artifact
trans: n. 人工制品，手工艺品；非自然存在物体（artefact 的另一种拼法）

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: iceberg
trans: n. [地理] 冰山；显露部分

sentences.english: The ship ran upon the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 轮船撞到冰山上。

sentences.english: Their ship circled the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 他们的船绕过了冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

detailed_translations.english: a very large mass of ice floating in the sea, most of which is under the surface of the water

name: salvager
trans: n. 拯救者；救援人员

name: sonar
trans: n. 声呐；声波定位仪（等于asdic） n. （Sonar）人名；（土）索纳尔

sentences.english: What good is a ship armed to the teeth if its radar and sonar are substandard?
sentences.chinese: 如果一艘武装到牙齿的舰船其雷达和声纳是不合格的，那能好到哪里？

sentences.english: In his work to develop radar, sonar and ultrasound he performed all the necessary tests and provided all the proofs required.
sentences.chinese: 在雷达、声纳和超声的开发工作中，他进行了所有的必要测试，并提供了所需的一切论证。

sentences.english: However, a spokesman for the Ministry of Defence said: 'The Royal Navy can confirm that they were not in the area using sonar and have not been for some time.
sentences.chinese: 英国国防部的一位发言人表示：“皇家海军能证明他们并没有在这一海域使用声纳，而且他们在这片水域逗留的时间也不长。

detailed_translations.english: equipment on a ship or  submarine  that uses  sound waves  to find out the position of objects under the water

name: submersible
trans: adj. 能潜水的；能沉入水中的

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲剧；灾难；惨案

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: archaeologist
trans: n. 考古学家

sentences.english: In fact, she was an archaeologist.
sentences.chinese: 其实她是一个考古学家。

sentences.english: But I do not believe, as a field archaeologist, that we can use the scientific method to prove or disprove [them].
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个在现场工作的考古学家，我不相信我们能用科学手段对它们进行证实或证伪”。

name: engraved
trans: adj. 被牢记的；被深深印入的 v. 雕刻（engrave的过去式）

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增加

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: illuminate
trans: vt. 阐明，说明；照亮；使灿烂；用灯装饰 vi. 照亮

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: lure
trans: n. 诱惑；饵；诱惑物 vt. 诱惑；引诱；引怪（游戏术语） n. (Lure)人名；(英)卢尔

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: outcropping
trans: n. 出露地表；露出；露头

name: banish
trans: vt. 放逐；驱逐 n. (Banish)人名；(英)巴尼什

sentences.english: John was banished from England.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被逐出英国。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

name: berserker
trans: n. 暴汉；狂暴战士 adj. 狂暴的

name: conquer
trans: vt. 战胜，征服；攻克，攻取 vi. 胜利；得胜

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: saga
trans: n. 萨迦，冒险故事，英雄事迹，传说；长篇故事；一连串的事件 n. (Saga) （瑞、俄、美）萨贾（人名）

sentences.english: The whole saga began back in May.
sentences.chinese: 整件事情的开始要回溯到5月份。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传说；冒险故事；英雄事迹
detailed_translations.english: one of the stories written about the Vikings of Norway and Iceland

name: alternate
trans: v. （使）交替，（使）轮流 adj. 交替的，轮流的；间隔的，每隔（……天等）的；（一或多个事物）另外的，可供选择的；（两者）互不相容的；另类的，非传统的；（叶、芽）互生的 n. 替换物，代理人

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: horizontal
trans: adj. 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的 n. 水平线，水平面；水平位置

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的；早先的；过早的 adv. 在先；在…以前

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: vertical
trans: adj. 垂直的，直立的；[解剖] 头顶的，顶点的；[植]纵长的，直上的 n. 垂直线，垂直面；垂直位置

sentences.english: a vertical line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: the vertical axis of a graph
sentences.chinese: 图的纵轴

sentences.english: vertical window blinds
sentences.chinese: 垂直百叶窗

sentences.english: The wall is several degrees off the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 这堵墙倾斜了有好几度。

detailed_translations.english: pointing up in a line that forms an angle of 90˚ with a flat surface
a vertical line or position

name: warp
trans: n. 弯曲，歪曲；偏见；乖戾 vt. 使变形；使有偏见；曲解 vi. 变歪，变弯；曲解

sentences.english: The door must be warped. It won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 这门肯定是变形了，关不严。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that has become bent or twisted from its original shape
if something warps, or if heat or cold warps it, it becomes bent or twisted, and loses its original shape

name: weft
trans: n. 纬线；信号旗

sentences.english: Usage: This detector is applied to plastic looms for stopping operation in case of broken weft and weft-out. It is composed of signal emitter, receiver and controller.
sentences.chinese: 用途：本检测器用于塑料园织机在断纬、完纬时控制主机停车之功能。它由信号发射器， 信号接收器和控制器三部分组成。

name: conserve
trans: vt. 保存；将…做成蜜饯；使守恒 n. 果酱；蜜饯

sentences.english: We must conserve our woodlands for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.english: efforts to conserve fish stocks
sentences.chinese: 保护鱼类资源的努力

detailed_translations.english: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

name: pollution
trans: n. 污染 污染物

sentences.english: California’s tough anti-pollution laws
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州严厉的反污染法

detailed_translations.english: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

name: population
trans: n. 人口；[生物] 种群，[生物] 群体；全体居民；[统计学] 总体

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋 vi. 向...提供资金

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: census
trans: n. 人口普查，人口调查；（官方的）统计，调查 vt. 实施统计调查

sentences.english: He and Mary journeyed to Bethlehem to be counted in the Roman census, and while they were there the child was born.
sentences.chinese: 他和玛利亚一起去到伯利恒，罗马的人口普查把他们统计在内。 他们在那里时，孩子降生了。

detailed_translations.english: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

name: enlist
trans: vi. 支持；从军；应募；赞助 vt. 使入伍；征募；谋取…的赞助或帮助

name: immigrate
trans: vi. 移入 vt. 使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: renovate
trans: vt. 更新；修复；革新；刷新

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: somber
trans: adj. 忧郁的；昏暗的；严峻的；阴天的

sentences.english: In the somber archives of a sedate museum a large archaic volume is somewhat conspicuously displayed.
sentences.chinese: 在一个平静的博物馆中昏暗的档案室里，一本厚厚的古书被摆在了很显著的位置。

sentences.english: Her 71-year-old husband, looking somber and composed, was brought into the church in a wheelchair and did not speak at the service.
sentences.chinese: 凯西71岁高龄的丈夫被人用轮椅推进教堂，看起来沉默忧郁，在葬礼仪式上也没有发言。

sentences.english: Don't ignore it because it makes you laugh — director Paul Feig's 2011 hit deserves as much respect as any somber, wintry, subtitled drama.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为它让你开怀大笑而忽略了它——总监保罗·法伊格在2011年引起的这场轩然大波与其他任何忧郁、寒冷、次要的戏剧一样值得尊重。

name: brand
trans: n. 品牌，商标；类型；烙印；（独特的）个性；烙铁；污名；燃烧的木头；（诗、文中的）剑 v. 败坏（某人）名声；给（牲畜）打烙印；加污名于，谴责；加商标于；促销；铭刻于，铭记；给（产品）设计品牌 n. (Brand) （美、德、瑞、英）布兰德（人名）

sentences.english: products which lack a strong brand image
sentences.chinese: 缺乏鲜明品牌形象的产品

sentences.english: The owner couldn't be bothered to brand the cattle.
sentences.chinese: 主人懒得给这牛打上烙印。

detailed_translations.english: a type of product made by a particular company, that has a particular name or design

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭刻， 打烙印于； 加污名于， 谴责
detailed_translations.english: When you brand an animal, you put a permanent mark on its skin in order to show who it belongs to, usually by burning a mark onto its skin

name: mustang
trans: n. 野马（产于墨西哥和北美平原）；海军行伍出身的军官（美国俚语）

name: rustler
trans: n. 偷牛贼；偷马贼；积极分子

name: stampede
trans: n. 惊跑；人群的蜂拥；军队溃败 vi. 蜂拥；逃窜 vt. 使…惊逃；抢占

sentences.english: a herd of stampeding buffalo
sentences.chinese: 一群狂奔的水牛

detailed_translations.english: to be made frightened or worried so that you do something too quickly, without thinking enough about it

detailed_translations.chinese: 逃窜， 狂奔； 热潮， 风尚
detailed_translations.english: when a group of large animals or people suddenly start running in the same direction because they are frightened or excited

name: vaqueros
trans: n. 牧童；放牛者；牧人 (vaquero的变形)

name: classical
trans: adj. 古典的；经典的；传统的；第一流的 n. 古典音乐

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: composer
trans: n. 作曲家；作家，著作者；设计者

sentences.english: ...music by Strauss, Mozart, Beethoven, and other great composers.
sentences.chinese: …施特劳斯、莫扎特、贝多芬及其他伟大作曲家创作的音乐。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes music

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培 vt. [细胞][微] 培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: ensemble
trans: n. 全体；总效果；全套服装；全套家具；合奏组 adv. 同时

sentences.english: an attractive ensemble
sentences.chinese: 一套漂亮的服装

detailed_translations.chinese: 全体；总效果；全套服装；全套家具；合奏组
detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes that are worn together

name: orchestra
trans: n. 管弦乐队；乐队演奏处

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。
